title.narrative: CALAM 16 Days of Activism GBV FR

description.narrative: CALAM (Coexistence with Alternative Language and Actions Movements) is a Tunisian human rights non-governmental independent association founded in January 2017 under the decree 2011-88 of September 24th 2011.CALAM embraces an alternative human rights perspective through innovating and creating unique ways of activism. Our main goals are to create a safe and brave space for vulnerable groups, empower them, and strengthen tolerance and coexistence within a society known for its discriminative nature. CALAMhas been working on violence against women since it foundation in 2017. CALAM is a non-profit, non-governmental organization, officially founded on March 20, 2015 following the terrorist attacks in Bardo. Initially, CALAM was a movement of young activists which came in response to the bardo attack encouraging nonviolent culture as a peaceful alternative to any kind of violence especially in popular areas which are infected with the phenomenon of terrorism. By practicing since 2015, and with the organizational evolution of the movement, the leaders of CALAM have decided to formalize it by constituting the association in its legal format under Tunisian law. The composition of the board of the association is predominantly feminist, a trend that has led to the identification of the association's currentprinciples being an openly feminist association given that gender-based violence is the type most observed within of Tunisian society. CALAM is officially recognized as an association on January 17, 2017. CALAM's missions are mainly: the promotion of human rightsin their own right, the promotion of feminist rights and freedoms by offering the alternative of "NON-VIOLENCE" culture and promoting freedom of expression with a focus on gender rights. CALAM believes that new technologies and the artistic field are the most effective means to achieve its objectives, and it is the alternative proposed by the association as well as its strategy to raise awareness and advocate the rights and freedoms of women and girls. in neighborhoods and working-class regions being the areas most “infected” by gender-based violence

participating-org.narrative: CALAM is a non-profit, non-governmental organization, officially founded on March 20, 2015 following the terrorist attacks in Bardo. Initially, CALAM was a movement of young activists which came in response to the bardo attack encouraging nonviolent culture as a peaceful alternative to any kind of violence especially in popular areas which are infected with the phenomenon of terrorism. By practicing since 2015, and with the organizational evolution of the movement, the leaders of CALAM have decided to formalize it by constituting the association in its legal format under Tunisian law. The composition of the board of the association is predominantly feminist, a trend that has led to the identification of the association's current principles being an openly feminist association given that gender-based violence is the type most observed within of Tunisian society. CALAM is officially recognized as an association on January 17, 2017. CALAM's missions are mainly: the promotion of human rights in their own right, the promotion of feminist rightsand freedoms by offering the alternative of "NON-VIOLENCE" culture and promoting freedom of expression with a focus on gender rights. CALAM believes that new technologies and the artistic field are the most effective means to achieve its objectives, and it is thealternative proposed by the association as well as its strategy to raise awareness and advocate the rights and freedoms of women and girls. in neighborhoods and working-class regions being the areas most “infected” by gender-based violence.
